prompt: <description>**CAD Model Instructions** **<part\\_1> - Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** The first part of the CAD model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1 unit in height. **Step 1: Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. This will position the coordinate system for the first part of the CAD model. **Step 2: Sketch** Next, create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch contains one face, face\\_1. Face\\_1 consists of one loop, loop\\_1. Loop\\_1 contains six lines: - Line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.224, 0.0] - Line\\_2: Start Point [0.224, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.44] - Line\\_4: Start Point [0.75, 0.44], End Point [0.224, 0.44] - Line\\_5: Start Point [0.224, 0.44], End Point [0.0, 0.44] - Line\\_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.44], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 3: Extrusion** Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.23 units. The sketch scale is 0.75. This will create the three-dimensional rectangular prism. **Step 4: Operation** The operation for this part is to create a new solid body. **Additional Information** The length of this part is 0.75 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.23 units.</description>
